sentences.sContent: Why should you spring my cricket bat?
sentences.sContent_eng: Why should you spring my cricket bat?
sentences.sCn: 你干吗非弄弯我的板球拍呢?。

sentences.sContent: An impromptu cricket fight in one of the stalls.
sentences.sContent_eng: An impromptu cricket fight in one of the stalls.
sentences.sCn: 一个摊位上正在进行的一场即兴蟋蟀大战。

sentences.sContent: But I lie quietly, listening to the cricket choirs outside. That remind me of childhood.
sentences.sContent_eng: But I lie quietly, listening to the cricket choirs outside. That remind me of childhood.
sentences.sCn: 但我静静躺了下来，听着外面蟋蟀的合唱，让我回想起了童年时光。

trans.tranOther: a game between two teams of 11 players in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running between two sets of three sticks
